question.questionText: How can you use a magnet to find out if the key is iron or aluminum?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: If the key sticks, the key is iron; if the key does not stick the key is aluminum.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: You will know because if it sticks it is iron if it does not it is aluminum.
If it attracts, it is iron. If it does not, it is aluminum.
If it is iron it will stick to a magnet if it is aluminum it will not.
Iron will stick. Aluminum will not stick.
